Flint, MI. 48503-1312
Re: License #: CB250410563
Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
11/20/2023. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
Pontiac, MI 48342
brownp2@michigan.gov
(248) 860-3012

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas.
• No technical assistance provided.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed on site on
11/20/2023. The Chief Administrator reported there were no licensing violations or
required CAPS submitted to DCWL during this reporting period. She reported the
agency provided care to five youths at Journey House and two were discharged
during this period. She reported the two that was discharged were unplanned
discharges. She said in the unplanned discharges, a 30-day letter was submitted
2

due to non–compliance with the program, contract, and expectations. She said
the behaviors exhibited by both youths were not appropriate for Independent
Living setting. She reported the agency has maintained substantial compliance
with the MDHHS – DCWL Licensing Rules for Child Placing Agencies, MISEP,
Policy and the MDHHS RFCAN Contract.
Financial Overview
The agency financial audit dated December 31, 2022, and 2021 conducted by an
independent certified public accountant was reviewed and indicates the agency is
current with obtaining their annual audit. The agency submitted their annual
financial budget indicating the agency is financially secure.
Staff and Youth Interviews
One Independent Living Specialist and the Independent Living Director were
interviewed on 11/20/2023 on-site. Staff reported they enjoy working at the
agency. Staff enjoy working with and helping the youth in their program.
Independent Living staff reported their supervisors, and the administration is
helpful, supportive, and very knowledgeable. It was reported that the
administration makes decisions that are beneficial to the agency. Staff reported
no concerns or suggestions for improvement.
Two Independent Living Youths were interviewed on site on 11/20/23. The youths
reported they are active in the program. They participate with their
education/vocational needs, abiding by the program rules and their individual
contracts. Both youths reported they are up to date with their medical and dental
needs. The youths said staff are very helpful and supportive and that they have
lots of food to eat. They had no safety concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space for staff to work and provide confidentiality. No
safety issues were noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
N/A
.
3

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
11/28/2023
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 28, 2023
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
4
